channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6547] testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0
item.description:
When I run the upgrade tests with 10.10.2.0 as the starting point, I see the following error. I don't see this error when the starting point is 10.10.1.1. This may suggest that 10.10.2.0 has not been added as a starting point for the upgrade tests in the nightly/continuous-integration test runs.

1) testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger(org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.upgradeTests.BasicSetup)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Expected error(s) ' 42802' but no error was thrown.
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.assertStatementErrorMinion(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:1194)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.assertStatementError(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:1145)

item.summary: testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I see the same error in the nightly tests at IBM, e.g. here:
http://people.apache.org/~myrnavl/derby_test_results/main/windows/testlog/ibm17/1589013-suites.All_diff.txt

I followed the steps for adding this release to the upgrade test directory, as indicated on the release publication wiki (http://wiki.apache.org/db-derby/ReleasePublication, currently shows up as step 5 and 6). I didn't think there was anything further to do...

The files have arrived correctly in the normal 'jars' location.
The upgrade test successfully runs the same test through the CREATE, SOFTUPGRADE, and UPGRADE modes, but it fails in the POST UPGRADE iteration...

I'm unassigning myself.
I thought maybe I had made a mistake in adding the 10.10.2.0 jars into the upgrade test framework, but I don't see how that could be if the test runs ok through some of the modes.

I did notice that the update statement is different for the PH_POST_SOFT_UPGRADE phase.

I can only think that there is a deeper problem here because of something that we backported.
Thanks for taking a look at this bug, Myrna. I am raising the urgency of this issue to Blocker. I think we need to fix this before we release 10.11. Thanks.

I've filed DERBY-6551 to get us to run upgrade tests from release candidates to trunk as part of the release testing, or automatic on the release branches, so that such problems can be detected and investigated before the release.
I see the same failure when I use head of the 10.9 branch as starting point for the upgrade tests.

The upgrade test failure seems to have been introduced by the following commit on the 10.10 branch:

------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1539074 | mamta | 2013-11-05 18:23:59 +0100 (Tue, 05 Nov 2013) | 6 lines

DERBY-6383(Update trigger defined on one column fires on update of other columns)

Backporting following 2 revisions from trunk to 10.10. Had to hand do the changes because of conflicts during svn merge.
1537593, 1538854

------------------------------------------------------------------------

I built jars at the head of 10.8 branch and upgrade tests with those jars failed too like 10.10. Knut mentioned that same that happened for top of the 10.9 codeline jars.I am debugging it further. Will post the findings. Interesting thing is failing test was written for a different jira(DERBY-5120) than the backport jira(DERBY-6383) which seems to have caused this failure.

Forgot to mention earlier that I verified the checkin r1539074 identified by Knut to be the cuplrit. If I bring the 10.10 codeline to right before that checkin, the problem does not reproduce and when the codeline is at sync with r1539074, you can see the test failure.

Commit 1596451 from Mamta A. Satoor in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1596451 ]

DERBY-6547(testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0)

10.10, 10.9 and 10.8 jars started failing in upgrade suite(in testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger) after following was backported into those codelines
*****
DERBY-6383(Update trigger defined on one column fires on update of other columns)

Backporting following 2 revisions from trunk to 10.10. Had to hand do the changes because of conflicts during svn merge.
1537593, 1538854
*****

The reason behind the failure is actually how testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger test was written and not a code regression.

The test creates a trigger which is supposed to fire on a specific column
create trigger ATDC_TAB1_TRG1 after update of C11 on ATDC_TAB1 REFERENCING old_table as old
for each statement MODE DB2SQL insert into ATDC_BKUP1 select * from old
But later on it the test, it is expecting the trigger to fire on update of non-trigger column of the table. This was fine before DERBY-6383 was backported because w/o the fix for DERBY-6383, triggers would fire on update of any column on the table(DERBY-6383 - Update trigger defined on one column fires on update of other columns). But after those codelines got the fix for DERBY-6383 as part of the backport, the trigger correctly won't fire any more on non-trigger columns and that started the test failure. I have fixed the test to update the trigger column in order to fire the trigger and now the test behaves correctly. I will backport this test fix upto 10.8 codelines which is how far DERBY-6383 got backported to.

Commit 1597699 from Mamta A. Satoor in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1597699 ]

DERBY-6547(testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0)

Backporting from trunk to 10.10

Commit 1597840 from Mamta A. Satoor in branch 'code/branches/10.9'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1597840 ]

DERBY-6547(testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0)

Backporting from trunk to 10.9

Commit 1597853 from Mamta A. Satoor in branch 'code/branches/10.8'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1597853 ]

DERBY-6547(testDERBY5120NumRowsInSydependsForTrigger fails when the starting version of the upgrade trajectory is 10.10.2.0)

Backporting from trunk to 10.8
Does not need to be backported any further since the failing test does not exist in codelines prior to 10.8
